DataElement.preferredName: Family Medical History Colorectal Carcinoma First Degree Relative Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical range that represents the number of first degree relatives are eligible for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Family Medical History Colorectal Carcinoma First Degree Relative Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives.  A patients family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions. (NCI)_A cancer arising from the epithelial cells that line the lumen of the colon.:Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary):A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives.  A patients family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

Property.preferredName: Colorectal Carcinoma First Degree Relative Number
Property.preferredDefinition: A cancer arising from the epithelial cells that line the lumen of the colon.:Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary):A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.

Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/14/2010 released DEC per direction of model owner as part of caDSR model cleanup activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Two And Less Than or Equal To Four
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition.
